最爱系列之一
Ótimo.

This game has aged like a fine expensive wine. The physics are good for the time it was made in, the wall-banging mechanic could have had a bit of a touch up though, and the bots radio chatter is adorable sometimes ^w^. This compared to its succesor CS:GO, I would reccomend this more than CS:GO. While GO is less expensive, I do feel that the extra 5 USD is not all that extrenuous when you are able to get the more expensive skins from GO for free in Source with skin mods. The nostalgia factor is amazing, going back to the days where the graphics werent Crysis 3 levels, when you had a Cathode monitor PC running Windows 98. Once again compared to GO, the skill gap in Source is not that large, with the larger hitboxes and easier spray patterns, this game is a cinch. Now to my complaints, the buy menu is not as fluid as it is in GO, and hitting headshots is a lot more difficult with quite a few weapons. This is as far as this review goes now, thank you for your time.

I'm only here for the 24/7 death match servers.
120/10

It really surprises me that there's still tons of people that play this game, but it also confuses me at the same time because how old is this game? 10 years old or something like that. There are only two reasons why I bought this game and I'm going to be perfectly clear on that, 1) I got it for Gmod textures just like everybody else that's buying this game now and 2) I bought it out of curiosity to see what the game was like back when it was in its glory days. After playing it for about a few weeks I can easily say I didn't have the fun I expected, mainly because I can't. If you're new to this game franchise don't expect it to be anything like Call of duty or Battlefield, you will get your ass kicked pretty fast if you play thinking that.

Now I wouldn't go off and say that this is the most tactical first person shooter ever, it's really not, but it requires a lot of teamwork, a lot of patience and good aiming, mostly headshots, so if you can't hit anyone in the head you're not going to get anywhere. I really like how this game encourages teamwork and that if you can't do that you're going to get steamrolled unless you're a complete badass, I also like how there was a long list of weapons that you could use to customize and suit your needs. I also really like playing on those servers that allow up to 40 people on them that make for some really good 20 versus 20 matches, those can be very chaotic but at the same time that's what makes it extremely fun to play.

Unfortunately I'm already running out of good things to say about this game and I really hate the fact that I have to say that. Overall the biggest problems with this game is its community, it feels wrong to really dislike a game because of the people that play it but in counterstrike sources case that's the truth.  Just like you would expect the community is full of nothing but haters, spammers, trolls, screaming 11-year-olds and people who think they're on top of the world just because they can kill you with a sniper rifle and while there are some good people, the bad mostly outweighs it. It's not only that but most of the servers you will go on will have people that are only willing to play one map which is usually dust or office and to make it even worse some of these people have the most inappropriate sprays I have ever seen. To add the icing on the cake there are some people that of been playing counterstrike source for years and are completely relentless against new players. We all know who I'm talking about, the people that can take you down in an instant as soon as you round the corner or the people that know every perfect peeking spot that you never thought to look at, I can't tell you how frustrating it is to walk 20 feet away from spawn only to get headshot across the map by a desert eagle when everyone in existence would agree that it was an impossible shot to make, yet these "veterans" are able to do it on a regular basis. It's even more of an insult when you light them up with the entire magazine of your gun and they can take it like a champ and still kill you by shooting you once, by the way this all happens normally in casual servers.

If you're out there looking for a new first person shooter to get behind it's hard for me to recommend counterstrike source unless you're extremely confident, a unnaturally perfect shot or can deal with some of the weird/annoying people that play this game or you need it for Gmod textures. Besides this is an old game, like a 12 year old game, I think there are a lot of other multiplayer shooters out there that are new and way more worth our time. Don't give me hate, I'm just one person with one opinion.
